page.title: 17LINGCROFT POOL PLEALEY
page.content: Lingcroft and the surrounding area has an abundance of wildlife. On the north-east side of the pool there is a squirrel's nest just next to a dam which drains into a smaller pool, which then drains off into a third larger pool. Altogether there are three pools in the district of Lingcroft. The owner gives out permits for fishing.Fish include perch,rudd,tench and some carp.The common frog and toad are also abundant. The pool seems to be quite old, considering the surrounding area.The north and south slopes have been planted with spruce trees and the remainder of the vegetation is natural. Birds seen come into three groups: feeding visitors, residents and water fowl. Of the plants there are between 10 and 25 varieties of trees, shrubs, flowers and grasses.
